item.title: Agents and Actor Models in F# 3.0 with Rachel Reese - .NET Rocks!

item.title: Master F# with Ted Neward! | Bellevue College Continuing Education
item.description: Blog. Master F# with Ted Neward! Ted Neward describes himself as “a big geek who takes great pride in making other geeks into bigger, better, more highly rewarded geeks.” Beginning with C++, Ted has spent the last 15 years diving into the tech industry. He's been working with .NET since before it ... F# to your professional tool kit,” Ted notes. “This hybrid object-functional language offers the best of both worlds by making it easy to do what objects do well and what functions do well. ” ...

item.title: SSIS Packages with F# (Part 1) | Visual F# Blog - FSharpBlog.com
item.description: Naturally, I thought of how nice it would be to use the power of F# to create the script, but I had no time to figure out how to trick SSIS into using Fscript instead of a C# or VB script. What a natural fit ... This is a functional member. You just have to love functional programming with its functional first class citizenship. F# Response Module. In my code, I chose to create a Response Module, which I could have easily made a Type, but instead I chose to make it a module. I may have been ...

item.title: Neo4j: Cypher – Creating relationships between nodes from ...
item.description: In a functional language we might not use the zip function create pairs from the collection. Cypher doesn't have this function but we can get close by using the RANGE function to select adjacent nodes. I started off with this query: ...

item.title: Abstractivate: From lists to trains to functors
item.description: The first useful bit of functional programming is the map method on List. It gives us a new List, which contains the results of the mapped function applied to each item in the list. We might think of it like this, mapping f over a List of a single item of ...
